name: react-component-library
description: A publishable React component library with TypeScript, Storybook for interactive development, Vitest for unit tests, and Rollup for dual CJS/ESM output. Includes accessibility-first component patterns, automated visual regression testing, and a semantic release pipeline.
unified_instruction:
# React Component Library

## Stack
- **Language**: TypeScript (strict)
- **Framework**: React 18+
- **Dev Environment**: Storybook 8
- **Testing**: Vitest + Testing Library + Playwright (visual regression)
- **Bundler**: Rollup (CJS + ESM output)
- **Release**: semantic-release + Changesets

## Project Structure
```
src/
  components/
    Button/
      Button.tsx          # Component
      Button.stories.tsx  # Storybook stories
      Button.test.tsx     # Vitest unit tests
      index.ts            # Named export
  hooks/                  # Shared hooks
  utils/                  # Utility functions
  types/                  # Shared TypeScript types
  index.ts                # Library entry point
dist/                     # Built output (CJS + ESM)
.storybook/               # Storybook configuration
```

## Conventions
- Every component exports: component, prop types, and a defaultProps object
- All props must have JSDoc comments (consumed by Storybook's autodocs)
- Components are accessibility-first: use semantic HTML + ARIA attributes
- No component may import from a sibling component directory (use hooks/utils for shared logic)
- Story files must cover: default, all variants, loading state, error state, disabled state

## Key Commands
```bash
npm run storybook      # Start Storybook dev server
npm test               # Run Vitest
npm run build          # Build for distribution
npm run release        # Semantic release (CI only)
```
